items.title: WhatsApp users can now add songs to their Status updates
items.author: Lauren Forristal
items.summary:
- WhatsApp launched a new feature allowing users to add brief music clips to their Status updates, starting March 28, 2025.
- Users can select from millions of songs, sharing clips up to 15 seconds for photos and 60 seconds for videos.
- The music feature is similar to Instagram's but offers end-to-end encryption, ensuring only friends can view the shared songs.
- The rollout of this new feature is underway globally, with expanded availability expected in the coming weeks.

items.title: YC-backed Taxo raises $5M to slash healthcare admin with its AI ‘reasoning engine’
items.author: Charles Rollet
items.summary:
- British doctor Ahmed Kerwan founded Taxo to reduce healthcare administrative burden using AI.
- Taxo's app facilitates tasks like insurance prior authorizations, patient intake, and medical billing.
- The AI ‘reasoning engine’ increases prior authorization approval rates to 98%, significantly above the industry average of 80%.
- Taxo recently closed a $5 million seed round led by Y Combinator, General Catalyst, and Character Capital.
- Founded in 2024, Taxo achieved $1 million ARR within six months and currently serves around 15 customers.

items.title: Nikola founder Trevor Milton pardoned by Trump
items.author: Sean O'Kane
items.summary:
- Trevor Milton, founder of Nikola, has been pardoned by President Trump after being convicted of fraud.
- Milton was convicted in October 2022 of securities fraud and wire fraud, leading to a four-year prison sentence in December 2023.
- The pardon follows Nikola's recent Chapter 11 bankruptcy filing as the company attempts to sell its business by mid-April.

items.title: Mozilla patches Firefox bug ‘exploited in the wild’, similar to bug attacking Chrome
items.summary:
- Mozilla has released an update for Firefox addressing a security bug tracked as CVE-2025-2857, which was actively exploited.
- The updated version is Firefox 136.0.4, which follows a similar pattern to a recent bug patched in Google Chrome.
- The bug allowed potential escape from Firefox’s sandbox, impacting other browsers like the Tor Browser, which also received a patch.
- Kaspersky's Boris Larin linked these exploits to targeted attacks on journalists and institutions in Russia.

items.title: Google rolls out user choice billing on Google Play in the UK
items.author: Ivan Mehta
items.summary:
- Google is launching user choice billing in the U.K. on March 29 for non-game developers.
- Developers can use alternative billing options but must also retain Google Play's billing system.
- Developers opting for alternative billing receive a 4% discount on fees paid to Google, which typically charges up to 30%.
- This move responds to a 2022 CMA investigation into competitive practices in app billing.
- Google previously proposed this billing choice to settle antitrust issues raised by the CMA.
- User choice billing is already operational in countries like the U.S., India, and Australia.

items.title: Krafton acquires controlling stake in Indian gaming studio Nautilus Mobile for $14M
items.summary:
- Krafton acquired a controlling stake of over 75% in Nautilus Mobile for $14 million in cash.
- Nautilus Mobile, founded in 2013 and based in Pune, is known for its Real Cricket franchise.
- The acquisition aims to strengthen Krafton's mobile cricket games strategy in India, a key market with growing demand for such titles.
- The deal is set to close by the end of March 2025, with Nautilus continuing to operate independently.
- Krafton plans to explore new gaming genres and expand Nautilus’ presence beyond India.
- India’s mobile gaming market is projected to grow from $640 million in 2023 to $1.1 billion by 2028.
- Krafton has previously invested $5.4 million in Nautilus and plans further collaboration for game development.
- JetSynthesys, which owned Nautilus previously, will remain a minority investor and partner in eSports initiatives.

items.title: Open source devs are fighting AI crawlers with cleverness and vengeance
items.summary:
- AI web-crawling bots are seen as a major nuisance by software developers, particularly in open source.
- Developers like Xe Iaso created tools like Anubis to combat aggressive AI crawlers that ignore robots.txt files.
- Anubis uses a proof-of-work challenge to distinguish between human users and bots.
- FOSS projects are more vulnerable due to their open nature and fewer resources compared to commercial sites.
- Some developers have resorted to extreme measures, including banning traffic from entire countries to mitigate crawler interference.
- Cloudflare and other companies are offering tools to confuse and slow down AI crawlers.
- The community is sharing clever ideas to trap crawlers into consuming irrelevant content.

items.title: Certification platform Certiverse nabs $11M series A led by Cherryrock
items.author: Ruben Garcia, Pablo Meyer, Frederico Lopez
items.summary:
- Certiverse raised $11 million Series A led by Cherryrock Capital.
- Founded in 2023, the platform allows organizations to develop certification exams at reduced costs.
- Clients include The Linux Foundation and HashiCorp, with significant savings on exam development costs.
- CEO Ruben Garcia has experience in the certification industry, having co-founded Innovative Exams.
- Certiverse aims to automate exam creation and expand its client base significantly with the new funding.

items.title: Trump’s auto tariffs are a gift to Tesla
items.author: Sean O'Kane
items.summary:
- President Trump announced a 25% tariff on all imported cars and certain auto parts.
- The tariffs could increase the costs of new and used cars but may benefit Tesla, as it builds all its vehicles for the North American market in the U.S.
- Tesla imports 20-30% of components, which will still incur tariffs, but it is better positioned than competitors like Ford and GM, who manufacture many vehicles abroad.
- The tariff could lead to higher prices for other EVs while Tesla could keep prices lower with potential new models.

items.title: Why HoneyBook’s $140M in ARR may finally justify its $2.4B ZIRP-era valuation
items.author: Marina Temkin
items.summary:
- HoneyBook has reported $140 million in annualized recurring revenue (ARR).
- The startup is valued at $2.4 billion, implying a valuation multiple of about 17 times ARR.
- New AI functionality aims to help users price services and grow client lists more effectively.
- Jeff Crowe, a HoneyBook investor, believes AI can significantly enhance the business.
- HoneyBook focuses on business management software for service-based entrepreneurs such as photographers and event planners.

items.title: Instagram now lets you speed up reels just like on TikTok
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- Meta-owned Instagram introduces a feature to speed up reels at 2x speed, similar to TikTok.
- Users can long press the right or left side of the screen to activate the speed-up feature.
- Instagram Reels has evolved from 15-second videos to allowing 3-minute videos, enhancing user engagement with quick content consumption.
- Concerns about short-form video content's impact on attention spans are noted.
- Instagram has previously adopted features from TikTok, indicating a continuing trend of mimicry in social media platforms.

items.title: Facebook Debuts a Revamped Friends Tab as Part of Its Return to ‘OG’ Facebook
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.summary:
- Facebook announced a new Friends tab focused solely on updates from friends, eliminating recommended content.
- The update is currently available only in the U.S. and Canada, featuring posts, Reels, stories, birthdays, and friend requests.
- This change is part of CEO Mark Zuckerberg's initiative for a 'return to OG Facebook' aiming to refocus on connecting with friends.

items.title: Twin’s first AI agent is an invoice retrieval agent for Qonto customers
items.author: Romain Dillet
items.summary:
- Twin launches its first AI agent, Invoice Operator, in partnership with Qonto, which serves over 500,000 customers across Europe.
- The Invoice Operator automates invoice retrieval, reducing the time Qonto customers spend gathering invoices from hours to mere moments.
- The tool automatically logs into services, retrieves past transactions, downloads invoices, and attaches them to the relevant transactions in Qonto accounts.
- Twin uses OpenAI’s CUA model and has already supported thousands of applications within months of launching the product.
- Twin envisions a future where AI agents become integral across various industries, streamlining tasks such as order management and information retrieval.

items.title: TikTok to launch TikTok Shop in France, Germany, and Italy
Signal downloads spike in the U.S. and Yemen amid government scandal
New Utah law makes app stores responsible for age verification
Ebay backs WunderGraph to build an open-source GraphQL federation
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- eBay has invested $7.5 million in WunderGraph to enhance its open-source GraphQL federation.
- Investors include eBay Ventures, Karma Ventures, and Aspenwood Ventures.
- WunderGraph aims to provide an open-source alternative to Apollo for API management, focusing on flexibility and scalability for enterprises.
- The company debuted its open-source solution, Cosmo, in late 2023, responding to demand for alternatives amid changes in Apollo's licensing.
- eBay is collaborating closely with WunderGraph, leveraging its expertise while providing crucial feedback for product development.

items.title: YC alum Mendel, a ‘Ramp for LatAm enterprises,’ raises $35M Series B
items.author: Mary Ann Azevedo
items.summary:
• Mexico City-based [Mendel](https://mendel.com/en-mx/) raises $35 million in Series B funding, totaling $60 million in equity funding to date.
• The company automates corporate spend management for CFOs, addressing employee expenses, vendor payments, and travel bookings.
• Co-founded by Alan Karpovsky and Alejandro Zecler, Mendel plans to expand operations from Mexico and Argentina into Chile, Colombia, Peru, and Brazil by 2026.
• Mendel's annual recurring revenue grew 2.5x year-over-year with gross margins over 75% and anticipates profitability by late 2025.
• Led by Base10 Partners, the round included participation from PayPal Ventures and other investors, focusing on serving large enterprises in Latin America.

items.title: Nintendo is Creating Virtual Game Cards for Cross-Device Portability with the Upcoming Switch 2
items.author: Amanda Silberling
items.summary:
- Nintendo announced development of Virtual Game Cards for better portability of digital games across devices.
- The feature allows users to easily transfer Switch games to new devices, making digital downloads more like physical cards.
- Available in late April, these cards enable lending games within a Nintendo Family Group for a limited time.
- More information about the Switch 2 is expected in a Nintendo Direct livestream on April 2, 2025.

items.title: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
items.summary:
- ChatGPT, OpenAI’s AI chatbot, launched in November 2022, has over 300 million weekly active users.
- 2024 featured key developments including a partnership with Apple and the release of GPT-4o with voice capabilities.
- OpenAI faced internal challenges with executive departures and lawsuits but is expanding its operations globally.
- Recent updates include improved image generation, voice assistant capabilities, and tools for building AI agents.
- OpenAI plans to release specialized AI agents costing up to $20,000 a month.

items.title: 4 days left to lock in $300+ savings for investor and founder tickets for TechCrunch All Stage
items.summary:
- 4 days left to save over $300 on Founder and Investor Passes for [TechCrunch All Stage](https://techcrunch.com/events/techcrunch-all-stage-2025/?utm_source=tc&utm_medium=post&utm_campaign=tcallstage2025&utm_content=earlybird&promo=post_eb4days_03272025&utm_display=).
- The event will take place on July 15 at SoWa Power Station, Boston, MA, with an expected attendance of 1,200 founders and VCs.
- Ticket savings offer ends on March 31 at 11:59 p.m. PT, and tickets can be purchased [here](https://techcrunch.com/events/techcrunch-all-stage-2025/tickets/?promo=post_eb4days_03272025&utm_campaign=tcallstage2025&utm_content=earlybird&utm_medium=post&utm_source=tc).

items.title: Google rolls out new vacation-planning features to Search, Maps, and Gemini
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
• Google introduces new vacation-planning features utilizing AI across Search, Maps, and Gemini, aimed at assisting users during summer vacations.
• The Search AI Overviews showcase trip ideas and itineraries for specific regions, with an export option to save recommendations in Google Docs or Maps.
• Airbnb’s Gems feature is now free, allowing personalized AI travel assistance and trip planning.
• New hotel price tracking feature enables users to monitor changes in hotel prices for chosen dates and locations, launching globally this week.
• Google Maps now can identify places in users' screenshot collections, offering a streamlined approach to planning trips based on saved images.

items.title: Times Internet spin-out Abound raises $14M to let more Indian Americans send money home
items.author: Jagmeet Singh
items.summary:
- Abound, a remittance app spun off by Times Internet in 2023, raised $14 million in its first funding round.
- The app focuses on serving the Indian diaspora in the U.S., tapping into rising remittance flows to India, which totaled $129.1 billion in 2024.
- The startup has over 500,000 monthly users and processed $110 million to $120 million in remittances in the past 12 months, with plans to expand its services further and improve tech infrastructure.

items.title: NHS vendor Advanced to pay £3M fine following 2022 ransomware attack
items.summary:
- NHS vendor Advanced will pay over £3 million in fines for inadequate security measures before a ransomware attack in 2022.
- The fine is half of the initial amount sought by the Information Commissioner’s Office, which was over £6 million.
- Advanced failed to implement multi-factor authentication, allowing hackers to access personal information of tens of thousands.
- The LockBit ransomware attack led to significant outages across NHS systems, affecting patient data management.

items.title: OpenAI will reportedly close its SoftBank-led $40 billion round soon
items.summary:
- OpenAI is nearing the completion of a $40 billion funding round led by SoftBank as reported on March 26, 2025.
- Other investors potentially participating include Magnetar Capital, Coatue Management, Founders Fund, and Altimeter Capital Management.
- SoftBank plans to invest $7.5 billion initially, with an additional $2.5 billion from an investor syndicate, followed by a second tranche of $22.5 billion later this year.
- This funding round could elevate OpenAI's valuation to approximately $300 billion, building on its previous $157 billion valuation from a $6.6 billion round in October 2024.

items.title: OpenAI’s viral Studio Ghibli moment highlights AI copyright concerns
items.author: Maxwell Zeff
items.summary:
- ChatGPT's new AI image generator has spurred a surge of AI-generated Studio Ghibli-style memes within 24 hours of its launch.
- CEO Sam Altman used a Studio Ghibli-style image as his profile picture, showcasing the feature's popularity.
- Concerns arise over copyright implications as AI tools recreate protected styles, with ongoing lawsuits against OpenAI regarding copyright infringement.
- An intellectual property lawyer points out that while style isn’t protected by copyright, the training of models on copyrighted works is under scrutiny.
- OpenAI claims it avoids replicating specific artists' styles but can recreate broader studio styles.
- The technology spurs debate over copyright laws and the legal status of AI-generated works.

items.title: Nvidia is reportedly in talks to acquire Lepton AI
items.summary:
• Nvidia is negotiating to acquire Lepton AI, which rents servers powered by Nvidia’s AI chips.
• The deal is estimated to be worth several hundred million dollars, according to sources.
• Lepton AI, founded two years ago, raised an $11 million seed round in May 2023.
• Together AI is a key competitor in the server rental market, having raised over $500 million in funding.

items.title: ChatGPT’s new AI image feature is delayed for free users
items.summary:
- OpenAI CEO Sam Altman announced a delay in rolling out ChatGPT’s AI image features to free users due to unexpectedly high demand.
- The expected launch was revealed on March 25, 2025, featuring native image generation and modification capabilities.
- Currently, the image features are available only to ChatGPT Pro, Plus, and Teams subscribers.
- OpenAI has faced similar delays in the past, often citing lack of compute capacity as a reason.

items.title: UnitedHealth removes mentions of DEI from its website
items.author: Zack Whittaker
items.summary:
- UnitedHealth Group has removed much of its website content related to diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI).
- Archived pages previously dedicated to DEI now lead to 'page not found' errors.
- A 2022 blog post featuring a conversation with the vice president of DEI was also deleted.
- The removal aligns with broader trends of tech companies retreating from DEI policies under pressure from executive orders.
- A new page titled 'Culture of Belonging' was added, lacking references to previous diversity efforts.

items.title: Island lands $250M in funding at a $4.8B valuation
The Lumon Terminal Pro computer pops up on Apple’s website
19 founders and VCs working with Elon Musk’s DOGE
OpenAI adopts rival Anthropic’s standard for connecting AI models to data
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- OpenAI is adopting Anthropic’s Model Context Protocol (MCP) for its products, enhancing AI assistants' data connectivity.
- CEO Sam Altman announced support for MCP via a post on X, emphasizing its role in improving response relevance.
- MCP allows AI models to interact with various data sources and creates two-way connections, benefiting developers and applications.
- Companies like Block and Replit have already integrated MCP, and OpenAI plans to reveal more about its MCP strategy soon.

items.title: SpaceX reportedly has a secret backdoor for Chinese investment
items.author: Rebecca Bellan
items.summary:
- SpaceX allegedly enables Chinese investors to acquire stakes through offshore routes like the Cayman Islands.
- This practice raises national security concerns, particularly since SpaceX is a defense contractor for the Pentagon.
- CFO Bret Johnsen revealed these details during a corporate dispute regarding a failed $50 million deal with a Chinese firm in 2021.
- Experts express concern that this strategy indicates efforts to obscure foreign investment interests in the company.
- Previous investigations suggest that Chinese investors use special-purpose vehicles to invest in Musk-controlled companies discreetly.

items.title: Leaked data exposes a Chinese AI censorship machine
items.summary:
- A leaked database reveals China’s development of an AI system designed to flag sensitive content, with 133,000 examples provided for training.
- The censorship system targets not just traditional taboos but also current socio-political issues in China, such as corruption and public dissent.
- Researchers express concern that AI technology is being adapted by authoritarian regimes to enhance information control and repression.

items.title: Bradley Tusk says he makes more money with ‘equity-for-services’ than he did as a traditional VC
items.author: Rebecca Bellan
items.summary:
- Bradley Tusk, managing partner at Tusk Venture Partners, claims traditional VC is dead.
- Tusk shifts to an ‘equity-for-services’ model, offering expertise in regulatory navigation in return for equity.
- He highlights the challenges faced by VCs, such as high interest rates and stymied IPOs, and the disillusionment with the traditional VC model.
- Tusk emphasizes making more money through equity-for-services, retaining 100% of the proceeds instead of sharing with investors.
- His firm, Tusk Venture Partners, will continue to support existing portfolio companies until 2031.

items.title: Fintech Mercury lands $300M in Sequoia-led Series C, doubles valuation to $3.5B
items.author: Mary Ann Azevedo
items.summary:
- Mercury has raised $300 million in a Series C funding round, doubling its valuation to $3.5 billion.
- The previous Series B funding round in 2021 valued the company at $1.62 billion.
- Sequoia led the Series C round, with participation from other investors like Coatue and Andreessen Horowitz.
- Mercury reported $500 million in revenue in 2024, with 10 consecutive quarters of profitability.
- The company serves over 200,000 customers and achieved a 40% year-over-year customer growth.
- Mercury plans to launch a consumer banking product later in 2024 and is looking to expand through acquisitions.

items.title: Nuclear startup Terrestrial Energy goes public via SPAC, netting $280 million in merger
items.author: Tim De Chant
items.summary:
- Terrestrial Energy merges with an acquisition company, netting $280 million.
- The Canadian company focuses on small modular reactors, planning to list on Nasdaq under the symbol ISMR.
- Designed to address past molten salt reactor issues, their reactor core will be replaced every seven years, incorporating advanced safety and cooling systems.
- Target markets include electric power, data centers, and industrial applications.
- Renewed interest in nuclear power linked to increasing electricity demand from electrification and data centers.
- Other tech companies, including Google and Amazon, are also exploring advanced nuclear solutions.

items.title: Has GetReal cracked the code on AI deepfakes? $18M and an impressive client list says yes
items.summary:
- GetReal raises $17.5 million in Series A funding for AI deepfake detection tools aimed at governments and enterprises.
- The company offers a forensics platform with features like a threat exposure dashboard and tools for safeguarding high-profile individuals.
- Key investors include Forgepoint Capital, Cisco Investments, and Capital One Ventures, with notable customers like John Deere and Visa.

items.title: A new social app is fighting rage-bait
items.author: Joe Trippi
items.summary:
- Sez Us, a social app founded by Joe Trippi, aims to eliminate rage-bait from online discourse.
- Rage-bait posts are designed to create controversy and drive engagement, influencing platforms like Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube.
- Users on Sez Us can rate posts based on approval, insightfulness, relevance, and politeness, promoting more constructive conversations.

items.title: YouTube is changing how YouTube Shorts views are counted
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- YouTube is altering its view-counting method for Shorts to improve creator insights.
- New views will count each time a Short starts or replays, increasing total view counts.
- The change aligns YouTube's metrics with [TikTok](https://ads.tiktok.com/help/article/video-play?lang=en) and [Instagram Reels](https://help.instagram.com/202865988324236).
- Creators can view an older metric called “engaged views” in YouTube Analytics.
- This update does not affect how creators earn money or qualify for the YouTube Partner Program.
- The new counting method goes into effect on March 31, 2025.

items.title: Waze removes Google Assistant from iOS due to ongoing issues
items.author: Lauren Forristal
items.summary:
- Waze has officially discontinued the integration of Google Assistant for iOS due to unresolved issues since 2020.
- Ongoing problems reported by users included the microphone not responding in the app.
- Waze plans to introduce an enhanced voice interaction solution and has been testing an AI-powered 'Conversational Reporting' feature since October 2024.
- Android users can still access Google Assistant for Waze, while a transition to Gemini is underway for other platforms by Google.

items.title: Amazon’s Alexa Fund is now backing AI startups
items.author: Ivan Mehta
items.summary:
- Amazon’s Alexa Fund, established in 2015, is expanding its focus from early-stage voice startups to AI solutions.
- The fund aims to invest in AI-enabled hardware, smart agents, and generative media following the rise of large language models and Amazon's Gen AI-powered Alexa+.
- Four new startups have received investment: NinjaTech AI, Hedra, Ario, and HeyBoss, each operating in various AI and tech domains.

items.title: What’s next for ATProto, the protocol powering Bluesky and other apps
Krisp is using AI to help Indians sound like Americans on calls
items.author: Ivan Mehta
items.summary:
- Krisp launches a feature to change accents during calls, starting with Indian English to U.S. English.
- The technology preserves the speaker's voice while altering phonemes for better understanding.
- The idea emerged from co-founder Arto Minasyan's personal experiences with accent comprehension.
- Initial beta testing showed a 26.1% increase in sales conversion and a 14.8% rise in revenue.
- Future plans include adding more accents and expanding to iOS and Android apps.

items.title: The TikTok ban is losing support among Americans, study says
items.author: Amanda Silberling
items.summary:
- A new study by the [Pew Research Center](https://www.pewresearch.org/short-reads/2025/03/25/fewer-americans-now-support-tiktok-ban-see-the-platform-as-a-national-security-threat-than-in-spring-2023/?utm_source=AdaptiveMailer&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=25-03-25%20TikTok%20ban%20short%20read&org=982&lvl=100&ite=15726&lea=4249848&ctr=0&par=1&trk=a0DQm0000053vznMAA) shows support for a TikTok ban among Americans has decreased from 50% in 2023 to 34% in 2025.
- Opposition to the ban has risen, from 22% in 2023 to 32% in the latest survey.
- Support for the ban has dropped significantly among all political affiliations, notably among Republicans from 60% to 30% and Democrats from 43% to 30%.
- TikTok users are less likely to support the ban (12%) compared to non-users (45%).
- Bipartisan support for banning TikTok still exists, with legislation signed into law by former President Biden last year due to national security concerns regarding Chinese ownership by ByteDance.

items.title: Amazon launches personalized shopping prompts as part of its generative AI push
items.author: Lauren Forristal
items.summary:
- Amazon introduced a new feature called "Interests" to enhance personalized shopping through AI.
- Customers can now use tailored prompts in the search bar based on their interests and budget.
- The tool utilizes large language models to convert simple language into search queries for more relevant product suggestions.
- Interests will notify users of new items, restocks, and deals related to their interests.
- Currently available to a select group of users in the U.S. via the Amazon Shopping app and mobile website.
- Amazon plans to extend access to more customers in the coming months.

items.title: Countdown: 5 days left to save up to $320 on TechCrunch All Stage passes
Google fixes Chrome zero-day security flaw used in hacking campaign targeting journalists
items.author: Zack Whittaker
items.summary:
- Google fixed a zero-day vulnerability in Chrome tracked as CVE-2025-2783, exploited in a hacking campaign.
- The bug allowed hackers to bypass Chrome's sandbox protections, affecting all browsers based on Chromium.
- Kaspersky linked the exploit to a phishing campaign named ‘Operation ForumTroll’, targeting Russian media and educational institutions.
- Chrome updates with the fix will roll out in the coming days and weeks.

items.title: Rivian spins out a new micromobility startup called Also with $105M from Eclipse
items.summary:
- Rivian has spun out a micromobility startup named Also, which has received $105 million from Eclipse Ventures.
- Also's team consists of around 70 members from companies like Apple, Google, and Tesla.
- The startup will focus on affordable micromobility solutions and plans to launch its first product, which will have a bike-like form factor, next year in the US and Europe.
- Chris Yu, Rivian’s VP of future programs, will serve as the president of Also.
- Rivian holds a minority stake in the new company and plans to leverage its technology and retail presence.
